page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: There are large areas of nineteenth and twentieth century housing deveopment in square 7527. Over twenty streets of nineteenth century terraced housing may be located. These follow a grid-iron plan, most having back alleys, allowing rear access to individual houses. The houses themselves are constructed from stone and have slate roofs. Size types vary. Most have two or three bedrooms. Dormer bedrooms exist occasionally. Twentieth century housing is dominated by council estates. l93O'S council housing is brick built, pebble-dashed and has slate roofs. l94O's and l95O's council housing is rendered with concrete and has tiled roofs. Council bungalows exist. These are brick built with tiled roofs. All council property has front and {more follows}
